name: Puissant Skill
effect: Muscle memory can aid the human body in accomplishing truly tremendous feats, allowing reaction with more speed and surety than the human mind can register. With this spell, a mage can perfect his muscle memory, drawing on even the most basic of training to hone his reflexes and responses to stunning and breathtaking perfection. The mage chooses a single Physical Skill when this spell is cast. For each success on the spellcasting roll, that use of the skill is considered a rote action Ability, allowing his player to re-roll any dice that result in failures on non-magical uses of the skill. At Life 3, the mage may grant this ability to others by touch.

rotes.roteDescription: Certain members of the Mysterium find that the best tool for a given job is the human body -- when faced liberating museums of Atlantean artifacts mistaken for simple archaeological finds, for instance. In such instances, the application of pressure to certain points in the body stimulates the flow of adrenaline through the body sufficient to prepare the body for upcoming action.
